example.eg: I think the waiter forgot to charge me.
example.egtrans: 我觉得服务员忘了向我收费。

example.eg: The barman didn't charge me for my drink.
example.egtrans: 酒保没有问我要酒的钱。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 因为…向…收费, 问…要…的钱

example.eg: The taxi driver charged me £15.
example.egtrans: 出租车司机收了我15英镑。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 向某人收钱, 收某人钱

example.eg: The lawyer charges a hundred pounds an hour.
example.egtrans: 该律师每小时收费一百英镑。

example.eg: I need to charge my mobile phone.
example.egtrans: 我需要给手机充电。

example.eg: The video rental shop has a late fee charge.
example.egtrans: 录像出租店会收取过期附加费。

example.eg: There are extra charges on my account.
example.egtrans: 我的账户上有额外收费。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 记入借方的款项，借项，应付款项，应付费用，收费

example.eg: John was innocent of the charges against him.
example.egtrans: 约翰是清白的，指控他的罪名不成立。

example.eg: This is heavy charge for such a small car.
example.egtrans: 对这么一辆小车来说，这个负荷太重了。

example.eg: The soldier was unimpressed by his charge to clean the whole barracks.
example.egtrans: 他命令那名士兵把整个营房打扫干净，士兵却无动于衷。

example.eg: Will you promise to help my family? Will you take this charge?
example.egtrans: 你会答应帮助我的家庭吗？你会负起这个责任吗？

example.eg: Pickett's charge was an important event in the American Civil War.
example.egtrans: 皮克特冲锋是美国内战中的重要事件。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 军事进攻, 突袭, 突袭

example.eg: The manager has charge of two shops.
example.egtrans: 那位经理掌管着两家商店。

example.eg: The charge on my phone has run down.
example.egtrans: 我手机快没电了。

example.eg: Instead of bullets, a taser shoots a 50,000-volt charge of electricity. When Steve touched the electrical outlet, the sudden charge made him jump.
example.egtrans: 泰瑟枪射出的不是子弹，而是5万伏的电荷。  史蒂夫碰到电源插座，忽然释放出的电荷让他跳了起来。

example.eg: Police believe that the bomber detonated a charge he was carrying.
example.egtrans: 警察认为是炸弹袭击者引爆了随身携带的炸药。

example.eg: The tutor's charges were all very well-behaved children.
example.egtrans: 该名老师手下的孩子全都表现很乖。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 被看管的人, 受照顾的人

example.eg: I charge you to look after the house properly while I am away.
The bull charged again and again.
example.egtrans: 公牛一次次猛冲。

example.eg: The infantry charged up the hill to meet the attack.
example.egtrans: 步兵冲上山头应击来敌。

example.eg: The boss charged in and demanded to know why I hadn't yet handed him my report.
The robber charged into the bank and shouted "Hands in the air!"
The bank charges a fee if your balance falls below a specified amount of money.
example.egtrans: 如果你的余额低于特定数额，银行将收取费用。

example.eg: The police charged Murphy because they thought he had broken the law.
example.egtrans: 警察指控墨菲犯了罪，因为他们认为墨菲违反了法律。

example.eg: The other team charged the quarterback.
The soldiers charged the cannon and it fired again.
example.egtrans: 士兵给加农炮装上弹药，炮弹又开始发射了。

example.eg: The lorry was fully charged with electrical goods and could hold no more.
The sergeant charged the corporal with command of the squad.
Just charge the bill to my account.
example.egtrans: 账单记我账上就行了。

example.eg: The police charged the man with a crime.
example.egtrans: 警方指控该男子有罪。

example.eg: The prison guard charged him with the cleaning of the latrines.
example.egtrans: 狱卒让他负责清扫厕所。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 冲走, 急匆匆地离开

example.eg: It is so annoying that I have to charge up my cordless drill every twenty minutes if I want it to work well.
Unexpected bank charges can cause your account to go overdrawn.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 银行费用，银行收费，银行手续费

example.eg: Airlines charge for everything these days; you even have to pay for peanuts!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 信用卡, 索价, 要价, 收费

dsense.name: charge nurse
dsense.guideword: UK (nurse in charge of a ward)

example.eg: There is a cover of ten dollars to enter the club.
In European restaurants you often find a cover charge for bread and butter.
The shipper pays demurrage only to the destination port.
The film was rubbish but it's okay because the seats were free of charge.
example.egtrans: 这部电影烂透了，不过还好，因为座位是免费的。

example.eg: Breakfast is provided free of charge.
example.egtrans: 早饭是免费提供的。

example.eg: The bank charged a handling fee of  £30 to convert the cheque from euros to pounds.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 手续费, 操作费, 处置费

example.eg: I'm trying to find out who's in charge here.
example.egtrans: 我想知道谁是这里的负责人。

example.eg: Wendy is going out tonight, so her husband is in charge of the children's dinner.
example.egtrans: 温迪今晚要出门，所以由她丈夫负责孩子的晚餐。

example.eg: As secretary, Jess is in charge of taking down the minutes of the meeting.
example.egtrans: 作为秘书，杰西负责记下会议纪要。

example.eg: Who's in charge in this department?
example.egtrans: 这个部门谁是主管？

example.eg: The editor is in charge of a large team of journalists.
example.egtrans: 编辑主管一个庞大的记者团队。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 负责, 主管, 是…的主管

dsense.name: in the charge of [sb], in [sb]'s charge

example.eg: The orphan was placed in his uncle's charge until he reached 18.
There is no charge for fresh towels; they come with the hotel room.  The manufacturer will send you product samples at no charge.
If you buy the vacuum you can also get a set of accessories for it for a nominal charge.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 象征性收费, 极少的费用

example.eg: The store clerk was rude to me, so I complained to the person in charge.
To get access, you'll have to speak with the person in charge of security.
Twenty dollars seemed a quite reasonable charge for mowing such a large lawn.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 合理的费用, 公平的价格

example.eg: There is a 10% service charge added to the restaurant bill.

dsense.name: shipping charge
dsense.guideword: US (cost to customer of transporting goods)

example.eg: When the captain was injured, the second officer had to take charge.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 负责, 主持, 看管

example.eg: Mara employed an accountant to take charge of her finances.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 控制, 掌管, 负责
